head.title: Wieden & Kennedy Fills New York Spot

hedline.hl1: Wieden & Kennedy Fills New York Spot

abstract.p: Amy Nicholson is named creative director at New York office of Wieden & Kennedy, succeeding Michael Prieve, who is on sabbatical and plans to return to Portland office this fall (S)

block.p: Amy Nicholson was named creative director at the New York office of Wieden & Kennedy, succeeding Michael Prieve, who began a sabbatical in May and plans to return to the Portland office in the fall.

Ms. Nicholson, 36, had been a senior art director at Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco, part of the Omnicom Group since 1996, where she recently worked on the ''Got Milk?'' campaign as well as accounts like eBay.com.
Amy Nicholson was named creative director at the New York office of Wieden & Kennedy, succeeding Michael Prieve, who began a sabbatical in May and plans to return to the Portland office in the fall.

Ms. Nicholson, 36, had been a senior art director at Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco, part of the Omnicom Group since 1996, where she recently worked on the ''Got Milk?'' campaign as well as accounts like eBay.com.

Ms. Nicholson will oversee all creative accounts in the New York office, including Krispy Kreme and Nike. She will be joined temporarily by Dan Wieden, Wieden & Kennedy's president, who is relocating to New York for a few weeks until her permanent creative partner is selected.
